This was THE FIRST modern PC videogame that i ever picked up when i was twelve, everything before that had all been consoles.
And somehow, it's as if everything i ever played after this missed... SOMETHING.
The ambience, the way the music always reflected the map, i'm pretty sure that playing this game made me ten times better at problem solving, since beating this game for the first time took me two days.

But after that it was like i could finally think clearly, thinking with portals made me better at looking at everything in life from an abstract point of view, philosophy now made sense to me because i could always try to see EVERYTHING from a subjective point of view, this game made me SMART.
And i'm not crazy, replay the game and pay attention to the maps and you'll see what i mean, there is an underlying philosophical pattern to how the maps are designed, it's not "just" a puzzle game, it's a game that is trying to challenge our preconceptions of reality, and by doing so is actively making us more open and understanding as thinking beings.
And it's a game that a CHILD can pick up and have FUN with, because learning is supposed to be FUN, but in this case it actually makes you smarter the more fun you have with it.
Now tell me that's not amazing!

This game is my childhood, and the fact that i still remember it so vividly speaks volumes of how timeless it is.
This is one of those games that i cannot even RATE, because this game is so good that it physically shouldn't EXIST.
It is as if god himself descended upon earth and gave us this game as an example of what a perfect video game looks like, to challenge the boundaries of human cognition while simultaneously being one of the most fun games EVER.
Fact: This game will go down in history as one of our greatest technological arts.

Portal is one of the greatest pieces of art ever created period. To summarize it, Portal is a linear puzzle game with a focus on a subtle yet funny narrative with interesting and creative level design. The game is so good that I believe this belongs on the list of "must play before you die" titles along side Deus Ex, Mario Bros 3, and Max Payne. The game keeps its length short, allowing for an extremely engaging pace that is worth much more then games touting the "100's of hours of content" their open worlds offer. But I do believe that nothing is flawless, and Portal is no exception. The game's only issue is that grabbing items can be slippery in Chell's (player controlled characters) hands and often fall to the ground without player input. But this in all honesty is a nit-pick that only effects players trying to achieve 100% completion. To put it simply, I beat Portal for the first time in only an hour and forty-five minutes, but it will take me years to forget the experience it provided.

Sehr gutes Spiel. Lobenswert auch im Jahr 2020 macht es noch Spaß. Die Level sind sehr schön gestaltet und das Gameplay macht viel Spaß. LEIDER hatte ich das Spiel nach einem Tag durchgespielt. ICH EMPFEHLE für 12€ (Stand 12.04.2020) Portal und Portal 2 zu kaufen. Alles in einem lohnt es sich sehr. Daumen hoch!

Es estúpido que escriba una review de este juego a esta altura de la vida o que nadie sepa ya de él, pero aquí va: [b]Es simplemente genial en todos sus aspectos[/b]. No te vas a cagar a tiros, pero si te gusta el humor negro, te vas a cagar de risa; y con un sentimiento de satisfacción indescriptible rara vez encontrado en FPS. Seguramente viste series de mierda en Netflix que duran más y te dejaron gusto a poco o nada, así que su longitud no es criterio de nada. No confío mucho en personas que jugaron esto y no les gustó.

Portal. Gra bardzo kultowa, dzięki jej mechanice portali. Wchodzisz jednym portalem, wychodzisz drugim. To kojarzy prawie każdy, ale nie każdy w grał w samą grę. Akcja rozgrywa się w tym samym uniwersum co popuralny Half Life. Wystarczyło mi ok. 1,5 godziny aby ją ukończyć. Oczywieście gra hula na wtedy już 3 letnim silniku Source, ale grafika bardzo dobrze się zestarzała. Pozycja świetna dla każdego gracza, niezależnie od wieku. Daje 9.5.

Definitely one of my favorite games of all time. It's Portal. It's a universal must-play. Nearly unparalleled gameplay, writing, visuals (for its time, they're still good tho), and world-building.
A full play through takes around 3 hours. I have 116 hours as of this review. That should tell you something!
